entry.title: Chinese culture @ 12 Zodiac Signs [12生肖]
entry.content:
The Chinese zodiac, or shengxiao 生肖 (born resembling), is a repeating cycle of 12 years, with each year being represented by an animal and its reputed attributes.

In order, the 12 Chinese horoscope animals are: Rat, Ox, Tiger, Rabbit, Dragon, Snake, Horse, Goat, Monkey, Rooster, Dog, Pig.

2020 is a year of the Rat.

  1. Rat – 鼠, shǔ (子) (Yang, 1st Trine, Fixed Element Water)
  2. Ox – 牛, niú (丑) (Yin, 2nd Trine, Fixed Element Earth)
  3. Tiger – 虎, hǔ (寅) (Yang, 3rd Trine, Fixed Element Wood)
  4. Rabbit – 兔, tù (卯) (Yin, 4th Trine, Fixed Element Wood)
  5. Dragon – 龙/龍, lóng (辰) (Yang, 1st Trine, Fixed Element Earth)
  6. Snake – 蛇, shé (巳) (Yin, 2nd Trine, Fixed Element Fire)
  7. Horse – 马/馬, mǎ (午) (Yang, 3rd Trine, Fixed Element Fire)
  8. Goat – 羊, yáng (未) (Yin, 4th Trine, Fixed Element Earth)
  9. Monkey – 猴, hóu (申) (Yang, 1st Trine, Fixed Element Metal)
  10. Rooster – 鸡/雞, jī (酉) (Yin, 2nd Trine, Fixed Element Metal)
  11. Dog – 狗, gǒu (戌) (Yang, 3rd Trine, Fixed Element Earth)
  12. Pig – 猪/豬, zhū (亥) (Yin, 4th Trine, Fixed Element Water)

& Chinese Zodiac Origins — Why 12 Animals

The Chinese Zodiac Story - The Zodiac Rankings Race

https://www.chinahighlights.com/travelguide/chinese-zodiac/story.htm

& Chinese Zodiac Years are based on Chinese lunar calendar

There are two dates a Chinese zodiac year could be said to start on:

  • Chinese New Year (day 1 of the lunar year), which is somewhere in the period January 21 to February 20
  • Start of Spring (day 1 of the solar year), the first day of the first solar term in the traditional Chinese solar calendar, which falls in the period February 3–5.

Most Chinese people use lunar new year as the start of the zodiac year. But for professional fortune telling, Chinese astrologers use ‘Start of Spring’ or solar new year as the beginning of the zodiac year.

As far as I know, concerning Zodiac Animal signs, we use only the lunar year.

The Chinese Calendar: https://www.chinahighlights.com/travelguide/guidebook/chinese-calendar.htm

CHINESE CALENDAR CONVERTOR: https://www.chinesecalendaronline.com/

& Ben Ming Nian (Zodiac Year of Birth)

As the Chinese zodiac recurs every 12 years, your animal year will come around when you are 12, 24, 36, 48, 60, 72, etc. According to ancient Chinese superstition, in your birth sign year, you will offend the God of Age, and will have bad luck during that year.

How to Make Good Luck in Your Zodiac Year Easily?

& Chinese Zodiac Hours

Every hour has an animal

It is widely known that each year is associated with a Chinese zodiac animal, but the animal signs are also assigned to months, days of the week, and hours.

According to professional Chinese astrology, a person’s personality and life is more decided by his/her birth hour than year. Zodiac hours, days, months, and years are used together for in-depth character and destiny analysis. In popular astrology, by contrast, only the birth year is used.

In ancient times, in order to tell the time, people divided a day into twelve 2-hour periods, and designated an animal to represent each period, according to each animal’s “special time, according to an ancient mnemonic and common observations.

Zodiac animalHoursMnemonicObservation
Rat11pm-1am [子]Rats forage most actively.The ancients heard them at this hour.
Ox1-3am [丑]Oxen chew the cud most comfortably.People of old would get up and feed them at this time.
Tiger3-5am [寅]Tigers hunt most ferociously.Chinese people long ago often hear them roaring at this time.
Rabbit5-7am [卯]Rabbits pound the ground most fervently.Rabbits were seen to come out of their holes to eat grass with dew at dawn.
Dragon7-9am [辰]Dragons hover most thickly.Morning mists, particularly coils around hills, made people think of dragons.
Snake9-11am [巳]Snakes emerge most readily.Snakes come out to sun themselves as the morning sun warms the ground.
Horse11am-1pm [午]Horses stand most impressively.When the sun is strongest, only horses were seen standing, while most other animals would lie down to rest.
Goat1-3pm [未]Goats eat and urinate most frequently.This was reputedly the best time to herd goats, when the sun had dried the dew on the undergrowth.
Monkey3-5pm [申]Monkeys play most vigorously.Monkeys were seen and heard playing and calling in the trees at this time.
Rooster5-7pm [酉]Roosters return to their coops most routinely.Roosters are routinely led back to their henhouses before sunset.
Dog7-9pm [戌]Dogs guard most dutifully.People would take their dogs out to keep a watch at night before sleep.
Pig9-11pm [亥]Pigs snuffle most sweetly.As they settled down to sleep, people heard pigs snouting their troughs.

It is also used to indicate directions. We’ll often see Japanese ninja seal casting used as well. There are also phalanxes and boundaries that are often used in some oriental films to indicate bearings and stars, thus creating some sort of mystical power.

It is also often used to indicate the five elements, thus acting like alchemy.

& What’s Your Zodiac Animal?

Chinese Animal Zodiac Sign Calculator

Based on Chinese lunar calendar.

& Chinese Zodiac Love Compatibility test

Is he/she right for you?

https://www.chinahighlights.com/travelguide/chinese-zodiac/compatibility.htm

Best Matches for 12 Signs:

  • Rat: Ox, Dragon, Rabbit
  • Ox: Rat, Monkey, or Rooster
  • Tiger: Dragon, Horse, or Pig
  • Rabbit: Rat, Goat, Monkey, Dog, Pig
  • Dragon: Rat, Tiger or Snake
  • Snake: Dragon, Rooster
  • Horse: Goat, Tiger
  • Goat: Rabbit, Horse, Pig
  • Monkey: Ox, Rabbit
  • Rooster: Ox, Snake
  • Dog: Rabbit
  • Pig: Goat, Tiger, Rabbit

& Chinese Zodiac is Used to Predict People’s Fortune

To make a relatively correct Chinese fortune prediction, people take many methods into consideration, such as face characteristics, palmistry, and more involved Chinese astrology including birth month, day, and hour, gender, etc.

Zodiac fortune prediction by birth year is only one of these methods. So you may only take Chinese zodiac birth sign horoscopes as a general reference.

See more on Fortune Telling in China — Methods, Benefits, and Tips.

Very complicated, Fortune-telling has a particular number of factors to consider, and the year of birth is just one of many.

entry.content:
The sites in UNESCO World Heritage list

China is a big country, so there are many tourist attractions. First of all, these sites are world class, best preserved, and most significant.

Next, I will show you how to find these sites list and basic information:

Open Word Heritage List: https://whc.unesco.org/en/list/&order=country

Ordering the sites by Country;

Find out Chinaand all related sites, there are 3 types: Cultural, Natural and Mixed site;

When you open any of them, you’ll see the relevant basic information, including description, gallery and video.

AAAAA Tourist Attractions of China [5A sites]

5A are the most important and best-maintained tourist attractions in the People’s Republic of China, given the highest level in the rating categories used by the Ministry of Culture and Tourism. Generally, World Heritage sites are already included in the 5A list.

Here is the list: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AAAAA_Tourist_Attractions_of_China

Best Cities to Visit in China

& Beijing — Ancient and Modern Capital
& Xi’an — a Window on China’s Ancient Civilization
& Shanghai — China’s Prosperous Largest City
& Guilin — China’s Top Karst Landscape
& Hong Kong — Like Nowhere Else on Earth
& Hangzhou — Next Best Place to Heaven
& Chengdu — Hometown of Giant Pandas
& Lhasa — Gateway to Transcendent Tibet
& Suzhou — Elegant Water Towns and Gardens

https://www.chinahighlights.com/travelguide/special-report/china-top-tourist-cities/

Finally, for more information, please refer to site China Travel Guide: https://www.chinahighlights.com/
